keter.name: Ark of the Covenant
keter.shortDescription: Sacred gold-covered chest containing the Tablets of the Law, the holiest object in ancient Israel

keter.name: Burning Bush
keter.shortDescription: Sacred site where God appeared to Moses in a bush that burned but was not consumed, revealing His name YHWH

keter.name: Frankincense
keter.shortDescription: Sacred aromatic resin used in Temple incense, representing purity and divine presence

keter.name: Ketoret (Temple Incense)
keter.shortDescription: Sacred eleven-ingredient incense blend offered twice daily in the Temple, representing unity and divine service

keter.name: Mount Sinai
keter.shortDescription: Sacred mountain where Moses received the Torah and Ten Commandments from God

keter.name: Tablets of the Law
keter.shortDescription: Two stone tablets inscribed with the Ten Commandments by the finger of God, given to Moses at Mount Sinai

keter.name: Yggdrasil
keter.shortDescription: The World Tree, an immense ash tree connecting the Nine Realms and serving as the cosmic axis of Norse mythology

tiferet.name: Ark of the Covenant
tiferet.shortDescription: Sacred gold-covered chest containing the Tablets of the Law, the holiest object in ancient Israel

tiferet.name: Burning Bush
tiferet.shortDescription: Sacred site where God appeared to Moses in a bush that burned but was not consumed, revealing His name YHWH

tiferet.name: Frankincense
tiferet.shortDescription: Sacred aromatic resin used in Temple incense, representing purity and divine presence

tiferet.name: Ketoret (Temple Incense)
tiferet.shortDescription: Sacred eleven-ingredient incense blend offered twice daily in the Temple, representing unity and divine service

tiferet.name: Menorah
tiferet.shortDescription: Seven-branched golden candelabrum that illuminated the Temple, symbol of divine light and eternal Israel

tiferet.name: Mount Sinai
tiferet.shortDescription: Sacred mountain where Moses received the Torah and Ten Commandments from God

tiferet.name: Myrrh
tiferet.shortDescription: Bitter aromatic resin used in sacred anointing oil and incense, symbolizing sacrifice and mortality

tiferet.name: Staff of Moses
tiferet.shortDescription: Divine rod wielded by Moses to perform miracles and lead the Israelites out of Egypt

tiferet.name: Tablets of the Law
tiferet.shortDescription: Two stone tablets inscribed with the Ten Commandments by the finger of God, given to Moses at Mount Sinai

tiferet.name: Yggdrasil
tiferet.shortDescription: The World Tree, an immense ash tree connecting the Nine Realms and serving as the cosmic axis of Norse mythology
